sentences.en: A precedes B in the alphabet.
Any finite sequence of symbols from an alphabet A is called a string.
sentences.cn: 由字母表A中的符号所组成的任何有穷序列,被称为符号串.

sentences.en: Assign the letters of the alphabet their numerical values — A equals 1, B equals 2, etc.
sentences.cn: 给字母表里的每个字母赋予相应的数值——A等于1，B等于2，等等。

sentences.en: By two and a half he knew the alphabet.
sentences.cn: 两岁半时他已认识全部字母。

sentences.en: He taught himself the alphabet of biology.
sentences.cn: 他自学了生物学的基础知识.

sentences.en: Its survival is evident in several of the letters of our alphabet today.
sentences.cn: 我们今天使用的字母表中有几个字母显然是它的残余.

sentences.en: Q comes between P and R in the English alphabet.
sentences.cn: 英语字母表中，Q在P和R之间。

sentences.en: The alphabet is usually ascribed to the Phoenicians.
sentences.cn: 人们一般都说字母表是腓尼基人发明的.

sentences.en: The alphabet might be more rational if all the vowels came first.
sentences.cn: 如果把所有的元音列在前面，字母表可能会更为合理一些。
英语共有二十六个字母.

sentences.en: The letters of the alphabet are very much alike.
The modern Russian alphabet has 31 letters.
sentences.cn: 现代俄语字母表有31个字母。

sentences.en: There are 26 letters in the English alphabet.
sentences.cn: 英语字母表中有26个字母.

sentences.en: There he learned to read the 26 letters of the alphabet.
sentences.cn: 在那儿,他学会了念字母表上的26个字母.

words.tran_cn: 字母的；[计] 依字母顺序的
按照字母顺序排列；拼音化
依字母顺序排列；用字母表示；拼音化

phrases.tran_cn: 国际音标；国际语音字母

trans.tran_cn: （一种语言的）全部字母，字母表
trans.tran_en: a set of letters, arranged in a particular order, and used in writing
